description: Many scholars suggest that this distinctive Tang form may have been inspired by earlier Hellenistic ceramic and glass vessels, such as the Greek amphora. If so, Chinese artisans thoroughly transformed that ancient shape. They created a high-shouldered silhouette with a slender neck gracefully framed by curved handles, whose dragon heads bite the cupped mouth-rim in their open jaws.
title: Dragon-Handled Amphora 三彩双龙耳瓶
